California examples of exempt assets, that cannot be sold or distributed are: ordinary and reasonably necessary household items and personal effects; jewelry, heirlooms and works of art (up to $7,625); bank accounts holding Social Security payments (up to $3,050); 75% of wages; retirement accounts; unemployment, Worker’s Compensation and disability benefits; and tools of your trade and one commercial vehicle (up to $7,625).
